comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: That must have been very outrageous at the time! Loving the personal message - I wonder what happened on Saturday night ... Rear view of Miss Pansy Montague, probably the same photo shoot - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview/?pi=nla.pic-an10714209-5

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] I'm impressed! How did she do the no-arms thing? Not sure what happened with Bill, but Ms Montague married Ferdinand Eggena! Her costume in this image is very very daring for the time. You know what they say, 'no publicity is bad publicity' :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] I think it was done with long black gloves, clever lighting, not moving (if it moves, it's rude!), and probably smoke and mirrors.

comment._content: Good photo I invite the group / Bona foto et convido al grup - Black Cat / Gat negre

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Black gloves & tricks of the light - fantastic! And yes, as long as it is stationary it can be classified as art - & not rude ;)
